text:
Hello,

It is a feature request.
It would be great and very convenient to have all config files in pure xml 
format. Current configuration format of virtual host is something similar to 
xml. But it would be much more convenient for users to have configuration (at 
least of virtual hosts) in pure xml format.
It is very convenient to have configuration in xml files because xml can be 
easily parsed and generated if necessary.
Can we expect to have xml configuration available for httd? And if so when this 
can be possible?

Thanks
creator: radick@rambler.ru
nick@webthing.com
text:
This has been discussed before.  Feel free to write or commission a module 
that'll run apache config as XML.  But it would not be convenient to break the 
existing httpd.conf so radically for millions of users.

creator: radick@rambler.ru
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> This has been discussed before.  Feel free to write or commission a module 
> that'll run apache config as XML.  But it would not be convenient to break the 
> existing httpd.conf so radically for millions of users.

Yes, I understand your position. But not always things you are used to are good.
And changing something doesn't mean that it would break something. As for me it
is not very radical change and I think about it rather as about improvement. As
about something that should happen with evolution of software and technologies.
And it can be good. 
I understand that such changes hardly to be done for existing version of apache.
But I hope that if some day you will start apache httpd version 3.0 maybe you
can take this option into consideration again. Maybe it can be good for the new
version.

I agree that an XML-format would be great. Quite a few other programms created in pre-XML times are in a similar situation.

But I also agree that some kind of mapping between XML and the current configuration file format would be necessary to be able to make such a change.

It might make sense to have a look at Kochizz (http://kochizz.sourceforge.net/), an "open source Apache configuration editor". Unfortunately that project seems to be dead since two years.

Any further ideas or suggestions?
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
